item.title: Jeremiah Jones
item.description: Hello, and welcome to my site! I’m a Statistician and Graduate Research Assistant at the University of Rochester, studying to complete my PhD under Drs. Ashkan Ertefaie and Robert L. Strawderman. My statistical research focuses on the intersection of causal inference with high dimensionality, selection, and nonregular inference problems. Some of my interests are: Causal mediation analysis Variable selection methods in causal Inference settings Post-selection inference techniques Personalized medicine through dynamic treatment regimes
